rows.ROLE REGISTRY — CANONICAL REFERENCE: One name per role. All aliases mapped. Every other tab points here. If it's not in this registry, it's not a role.
Every tab in the Trade that references a role must use the CANONICAL NAME from this registry.
If an old tab says 'Actor/Host' — that's the MC. If it says 'VA' — that's the Admin. If it says 'Lead PM' — that's a PM Co-Founder.
Aliases exist because the model evolved. This registry freezes the vocabulary. The Conceptual Index should import these definitions.
Stay for the full production cycle. The connective tissue. Without these three, the Trade can't coordinate.

rows.col_2: Nilo
Dean, Founder, Studio, Danilo, On-call SME, Trade Author
PERSISTENT — but NOT day-to-day after initial conditions set

Produces M0 (thesis). Sets initial conditions. Writes specific essays when asked by a PM. Final sign-off authority on V-tabs. Greenlight on all equity grants. Does NOT manage production, scheduling, routing, or daily operations.
SCL-0 + BCL-0 (thesis clusters). Greenlight authority on everything. Override authority on grades (logged, rare).
Nobody (founder)
Librarian, Conductor, MC (persistent roles). But 'reports to' is loose — the artifact coordinates, not Nilo.
Phase 0 (Pre-Imagination): builds the Trade. Phase 3 (Expert Review): final sign-off. On-call otherwise.
Majority equity holder
Permanent. But the experiment tests whether Nilo's involvement can approach zero during production.
N/A — this is Nilo's company
S4-Taxonomy (Dean), Role Index (Nilo section), Revised Roles, Labor Architecture v3
Librarian (Elaine) — CONFIRMED
Elaine, Registrar, Trade Custodian, Information Architect, First Hire. NOTE: Elaine is now a real person, not a placeholder.
PERSISTENT — first hire, full production cycle

Maintains both Passets (Imagination + Implementation). Distributes tab slices to each person's Google Drive folder. Updates master when graded work returns. Tracks status of every TUP (not started / in production / in review / verified / locked). Routes cross-TUP dependencies. Answers 'where is X' instantly. Does NOT judge content, grade work, or make strategic decisions.
SCL-1: People & Culture (9 models) + custody of entire Trade. Owns the file system, not the content.
Nilo (loosely). Day-to-day works with Conductor on sequencing.
Nobody reports TO them. Everyone reports THROUGH them — work goes in and out via the librarian.
Phase 1-4 (all imagination phases): routing, QA, tracking. Phase 5: extracts implementation tasks.
0.5% equity. No cash. Equity-only. Hiring a believer.
Full cycle (12+ weeks). May convert to permanent ops role.
'I was the information architect for a 1,100-tab venture studio launch coordinating 40+ contributors.'
Detail-oriented. Comfortable with spreadsheets. Library science student, executive assistant, project coordinator, virtual assistant. Does NOT need business strategy understanding.
Librarian Role, S4-Taxonomy (Registrar), Role Index (Librarian section), Flash Teams Model
No direct equivalent in Vicioso model — Vicioso has the 'Platform' doing this function. The Librarian is the human instantiation of platform custody.
Conductor
Ops backbone, Studio coordinator, Pipeline manager. Sometimes overlaps with 'Admin' in older tabs.
PERSISTENT — full production cycle

Manages logistics — scheduling, onboarding prep, tool access. Sequences production — which clusters activate when, who's available, what's blocked. Builds ops site + Shopify storefront using AI tools. Does NOT source people (Recruiter does that). Does NOT produce content or grade work.
SCL-2: Studio Operations (if applicable). Owns the production schedule and people pipeline.
Nilo (loosely). Works daily with Librarian on sequencing.
Flash roles (PMs, experts) report logistics to Conductor. Conductor manages their scheduling, not their work quality.
Phase 0-1: sourcing people. Phase 2: scheduling reviews. Phase 5: scheduling implementation handoffs.
0.3% equity. No cash. Equity-only. Hiring a believer.
Full cycle (12+ weeks).
'I coordinated 40+ flash contributors across 10 clusters for a venture studio production.'
Operations-minded. Recruiter instincts. Comfortable managing multiple concurrent pipelines. Think: production coordinator, talent coordinator, ops associate.
Revised Roles, Flash Teams Model (step 2: FIND), Launch Narrative, People Track

Older tabs use 'Admin' or 'VA' for some Conductor functions. The Admin/VA role (cold email, filings, screening) is now ABSORBED into the Conductor. If a tab says 'VA sources candidates' — that's the Conductor.
MC
Master of Ceremonies
Actor/Host, Host, Daily Update Person, On-camera talent, Content person. In Labor Chain v2: 'Actor' is an older alias for MC.
PERSISTENT — full production cycle

PRODUCES A LIVE SHOW documenting the company being born in real time.

TWO CONTENT FORMATS:
• LONG-FORM CONVERSATIONS (2-3 per week, run as long as they run — 1-3 hours each). Joe Rogan style. Onboarding new people, expert reviews, PM check-ins, milestone celebrations, failures, pivots. These ARE the episodes. Don't cut them short.
• DAILY HIGHLIGHT (15 min, ESPN SportsCenter energy). Recap of whatever happened that day — who joined, what got graded, what broke, what shipped. MC doesn't need to be on every call. Gets debrief from Librarian/Conductor and riffs on it.

MC does NOT need to be present for everything. Shows up for key moments (long-form) and synthesizes the rest (daily highlight).

Workload: ~10-12 hours/week. ~120-150 hours over 12 weeks. Doable with a full-time job.
0 TUPs (produces content, not models). ALL TUPs are storylines — the MC has narrative access to everything.
Series Producer (for narrative quality). Nilo (for strategic direction).
Nobody. But everyone participates in their show — PMs, experts, Nilo all appear as cast members.
All phases. The show runs from Day 1 to graduation. The show IS the company's origin story.
10% equity + content rights (they own their reel). No cash. Equity-only. Hiring a believer, not a contractor.
Full cycle (12+ weeks). Possibly permanent — the show doesn't end when the Trade locks.
'I produced 120-150 hours of hosted content — long-form interviews + daily highlights — documenting the birth of a funded company from zero.'

Good on camera. Genuinely curious. Asks the obvious questions that experts skip. Not a journalist — more like a podcast host who happens to be embedded in the production. Think: hot ones energy, not CNBC energy.

• Season = the full production cycle (12+ weeks)
• Long-Form Episode = one key conversation (1-3 hours raw, can edit or release full)
• Daily Highlight = 15-min ESPN-style recap (what happened today)
• Cast Page = every person who's appeared, with their episodes
• Story Arc = the company going from 0 to funded to operating
• Frequency = 2-3 long-form per week + daily 15-min highlight = ~10-12 hrs/week
S4-Taxonomy (Host), Labor Architecture v3 (MC section), Flash Teams Model (steps 3 and 7), Launch Narrative, Revised Roles, Labor Chain v2 (Actor/Host)

No direct equivalent. Vicioso has 'validation conversations' — the MC turns those into a live show. The MC is what happens when you take the Vicioso validation requirement (16+ conversations) and make it content.

rows.ROLE REGISTRY — CANONICAL REFERENCE: Come in for one sprint. Produce a specific deliverable. Dissolve. May never interact with anyone except MC and Librarian.

rows.col_2: PM Co-Founder
Cluster PM, Cluster Lead, Lead PM, PM, Project Manager, Co-Founder, Builder. NOTE: 'Lead PM' in Expanded Labor Sequence = the first PM Co-Founder hired (PM CL-1), not a separate role.
FLASH — 2-3 week sprint per cluster

Owns one cluster of 4-8 TUPs. Runs it like a production. Uses Claude as co-pilot to produce content tabs. Coordinates with expert reviewer. Drives milestones. Makes decisions within M0 constraints. Does NOT navigate the raw 1,100-tab spreadsheet — works from their extracted Google Drive folder.
ONE cluster only. 4-8 TUPs with clear boundaries. Their name goes on the docs.
Librarian (for routing). Conductor (for scheduling). Nilo (for thesis questions). MC (for on-air conversations).
Expert reviewer (loosely — they coordinate review timing, not the expert's judgment).
Phase 1 (Imagination AI Draft): produces content. Phase 2 (Internal Review): responds to librarian QA.
0.5% equity. No cash. Equity-only. Hiring a believer.
2-3 weeks per sprint. May do multiple sprints across different clusters.
'I was co-founder on [cluster domain] for a funded venture studio launch. Built [X] TUPs, graded [grade] by domain expert.'
7-10 across the full production. One per cluster. Some clusters may need 2 sprints.
Organized, relentless, comfortable using Claude as primary tool. Does NOT need domain expertise — that's what the expert reviewer provides. Needs: project management instinct, quality taste, speed.
S4-Taxonomy (PM Co-Founder), Role Index (PM sections by cluster), Flash Teams Model, Labor Architecture v3, Labor Chain v2, Revised Roles, Course Template
Maps to 'Owner' in Vicioso model — the person who runs a trade. But scoped to one cluster, not the whole trade. Multiple PM Co-Founders = distributed ownership.
Expert Reviewer
Expert, Domain Validator, Domain Expert, Grader (when in grading context), Venture Partner (in Expanded Labor Sequence — VPs who go deeper than review)
FLASH / ADVISOR — 10-20 hours over 2 weeks per cluster. Advisor relationship, not contractor.

Reviews and grades TUPs in their domain. Reads through tabs. Applies ACP criteria: Attestation (is it true?), Completeness (is everything there?), Plausibility (could it work?). Marks what's wrong. Provides calibration. Their name goes on the verified TUP. THIS IS THE GRADING AUTHORITY — expert grade is 60% of TUP cumulative grade.
0 TUPs. They grade, they don't own. Their authority is the grade, not the content.
Nobody. Their grade is independent. PM Co-Founder coordinates timing, not judgment.
PM Co-Founder receives their grade and remediation notes.
Phase 3 (Expert Review) only. Flash in, grade, flash out.
0.1-0.25% equity per cluster reviewed. No cash. Advisor framing — their name on the verified TUP + show appearance is the compensation. Credit, content, and equity.
10-20 hours total. Spread over 2 weeks. Not a quick phone call.
'Domain validator on [X] for a venture studio operating model. My name is on the verified docs.'
8-12 across the full production. 1-2 per cluster. High-stakes TUPs may get a primary + secondary reviewer.

Actual domain expertise. Has done the thing the TUP describes. Media buyer reviews media buying TUP. Supplement formulator reviews product spec TUP. They don't need to understand the Trade — just their domain.
S4-Taxonomy (Expert Reviewer), Flash Teams Model, Labor Architecture v3, Grading System, Course Template
Maps to 'Regulatory Body' function in Vicioso model — independent grading. In IonWave, expert reviewers ARE the proto-regulatory body.
Series Producer
Content producer, Show runner, Narrative architect
FLASH — 1-2 week sprint, may recur

Plans the narrative arc of the MC's live show. Story bible. Episode calendar. Cast management. Production quality oversight. Ensures the show has structure — not just random conversations but an unfolding story with arcs, tension, resolution. Manages the MC's output quality.
SCL-4: Content & Distribution (4 models). Owns the show's structure, not the business content.
Nilo (for strategic narrative direction).
MC (for production quality and narrative structure).
Phase 0-1: plans show structure. Throughout: quality checks on narrative arc.
0.3-0.5% equity + content rights
1-2 week sprint for setup. May recur for narrative check-ins.
Documentary producer instincts. Understands story structure. Can see the arc in real events.
S4-Taxonomy (Series Producer), Revised Roles, Flash Teams Model

rows.ROLE REGISTRY — CANONICAL REFERENCE: REMOVED. Site builds (launchionwave.com + Shopify storefront) moved to Conductor + AI. No dedicated product hire needed. Conductor uses AI tools (Webflow/Shopify templates + Claude) to build functional sites. Saves 2-4% equity.
rows.col_2: Product Person
Site Builder, Web Developer, Designer
FLASH — 2-3 week sprint
Builds the site(s). Sets up CMS so MC can post without code. Consumer-grade, cinematic quality. Does NOT own models — builds infrastructure that the content lives on.
0 TUPs. Project-based deliverable.
Conductor (for scheduling). PM Co-Founder or Nilo (for spec).
Phase 1 only. Build, deliver, dissolve.
2-4% equity + paid from raise if funded + portfolio rights
2-3 week sprint. Full-time during sprint.

launchionwave.com (ops/coordination — password-protected, investor/team facing) and customer domain TBD (Shopify storefront — public, customer-facing). These may be built by different people or same person, different sprints.
S4-Taxonomy (Product Person), Labor Architecture v3, Labor Chain v2, Revised Roles

rows.ROLE REGISTRY — CANONICAL REFERENCE: Activated after capital is raised. These roles execute the Implementation Passet.

rows.col_2: CoS
Chief of Staff / IonWave Operator
Operator, CEO (in some contexts), IonWave GM. NOTE: in Expanded Labor Sequence, 'CoS' appears at link D2 as an earlier-stage role — that's the Conductor in current vocabulary.
POST-FUNDING — full-time after raise
Runs IonWave day-to-day. Inherits the verified Trade as operating system. Executes the Implementation Passet. First real operator hire. May be a PM Co-Founder who performed well and wants to stay.
All M-level models (41) in implementation mode. The actual business.
Nilo (as board/founder).
Phase 5+ (Implementation and Execution). Not active during imagination production.
5-15% equity + salary from raise
Week 8+ (pipeline starts earlier via Conductor). Enough verified clusters must exist to be compelling.
S4-Taxonomy (CoS), Labor Architecture v3, Labor Chain v2, Expanded Labor Sequence (D9), Phase 0 - Trade Setup
Maps to 'Founder' in Vicioso model — the person who runs the company that the OOUP created.
Steward
Caio, Initial Conditions Auditor, Week 0 cleanup
ONE-TIME — Week 0 only
Audits the Trade structure before production begins. Organizes tabs. Verifies initial conditions. May help hire the Librarian. The 10-point structural audit from S41 research design.
1 week (Week 0)
Initial Conditions Audit, Revised Roles, S41-White Paper (Section 6)
Funnel Builder (Dan James is a specific candidate, not the role name)
Dan James, Thakos, YouTube person, Content builder
FLASH — 2-3 week sprint, may recur for funnel clusters
Builds and runs the funnel level. YouTube, lead magnets, email sequences, landing pages. Reference model for funnel production quality.
FCL-0 + FCL-1 + FCL-3 (16 models across funnel clusters)
S4-Taxonomy (Dan James/Thakos), Revised Roles, Role Index
Recruiter
Talent Sourcer, Hiring Lead. NOTE: This is NOT the old Conductor. Recruiter is a dedicated sourcing role.
PERSISTENT — full production cycle

Finds everyone. PMs, Conductor, Expert Advisors, Series Producer, Funnel Builder, Steward. Cold sources from Upwork, LinkedIn, job boards, communities. Writes compelling posts that attract A-players for equity-only roles. Screens candidates. Passes qualified people to Nilo for final yes/no on persistent roles, or directly to Librarian for flash role onboarding. Does NOT manage people after they're hired — that's the Conductor's job. The Recruiter fills seats. The Conductor coordinates the people in them.
0 TUPs. Owns the candidate pipeline and hiring funnel.
Nilo (for hiring priorities and final approvals).
Nobody. They source and screen. Hiring decisions are Nilo's.
Phase 0 (sourcing first wave) through Phase 2 (sourcing flash roles as clusters activate). Front-loaded — heaviest work is Weeks 0-4.
0.5% equity. No cash. Equity-only. The person who builds the team gets upside in what the team builds.
Full cycle (12+ weeks). May reduce to part-time after initial wave is hired (Weeks 4-6).
"I recruited and assembled a 30+ person flash team for a venture studio launch. Zero budget. Equity-only roles. Built the entire talent pipeline from scratch."

Resourceful. Comfortable cold-messaging strangers. Good writer — the Upwork post and LinkedIn outreach IS the recruiting. Doesn't need domain expertise in any field — needs to know how to find and pitch people. Think: startup recruiter, talent sourcer, community builder, someone who's run a Discord or community before.
Role Registry (this entry), Recruiting Chain, Continuity Protocol (backup registry)

Recruiter FINDS people. Conductor COORDINATES people after they're found. Recruiter fills the pipeline. Conductor manages scheduling, sequencing, tool access, and two-key counter-signing. Both are persistent. Both are equity-only. Different jobs.

rows.ROLE REGISTRY — CANONICAL REFERENCE: ├── Conductor (sources people, manages pipeline, sequences production)
├── MC → Series Producer (produces the live show)
├── PM Co-Founders ×7-10 (one per cluster, flash sprints)
│     └── Expert Reviewers ×8-12 (grade PMs' work, independent judgment)
├── Funnel Builder (builds funnel level, flash sprint)
The reporting structure is weak on purpose. The ARTIFACT coordinates, not the hierarchy.
The Librarian routes work. The Conductor sources people. The MC documents everything.
But the TABS tell each person what to do, what done looks like, and who they're handing off to.
This is the core claim of the research paper: the coordination artifact replaces management.

rows.col_2: Recruiter
Talent sourcer, People finder. NOTE: was partially absorbed into Conductor in earlier specs. Now separated as dedicated role.
PERSISTENT — full production cycle

Sources PMs and Conductor. 5-8 hires total. Does NOT source expert advisors — PMs find their own domain experts. Does NOT source MC — Nilo finds MC. Owns the recruiting pipeline, candidate tracking, initial screening. Hands qualified candidates to Nilo for final decision.
Recruiting pipeline. Candidate tracker (shared doc). Screening criteria per role.
Nilo (for hiring decisions). Works with Conductor (for scheduling once people are hired).
Nobody. Recruiter sources, doesn't manage.
Week 0 through Week 6. Front-loaded — most hiring happens early. Tapers as production fills up.
0.3% equity. No cash. Equity-only.
Active recruiting for 6-8 weeks. On-call after that for replacement sourcing.
"I recruited the founding team for a venture studio launch — 5-8 hires across ops, content, and project management, all equity-only."
Scrappy sourcer. Comfortable on Upwork, LinkedIn, Discord communities. Can write compelling outreach. Doesn't need HR experience — needs hustle and judgment about people.
From your network. Tabs team. Fund network. Someone who's good at finding people and would do it for equity because they believe in what you're building.
Recruiter, MC, Elaine (Librarian) ✓ DONE
PMs (5-8), Conductor
Their own Expert Advisors (from their domain network)
Future hires via the show (once running, the show is a recruiting magnet)
Everyone finds 2-3 from their own world.

rows.ROLE REGISTRY — CANONICAL REFERENCE: All roles — including persistent roles — operate on rolling 2-week commitments. Nobody commits to 12 weeks upfront.
See Commitment Protocol tab for: commitment units per role, daily check-in format, tripwires, re-up ritual.
